subTitle: Ask us any questions about our CISCAfrica project and get factual answers.

faqs.question: How to contribute?
faqs.answer: To contribute, access the 'I contribute' section and fill out the form, or click on this [link](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Vdr3PbcZzwoGFT5-RIudQZVJ921ByHuphNSLvvMy07w/edit). You can also contact our teams via info@africtivistes.org for an interview.

faqs.question: What types of data are aggregated?
faqs.answer: We collect qualitative and quantitative data related to the electoral initiatives of African civil society, including their type, field of activity, nature, targets, scope, and means of intervention.

faqs.question: How are the data collected?
faqs.answer: The data are collected via a questionnaire, documentary research, and interviews.

faqs.question: What are the main initiatives covered by CISCAfrica?
faqs.answer: CISCAfrica lists citizen initiatives covering the entire electoral cycle, from voter awareness to election observation.

faqs.question: How can I access CISCAfrica data?
faqs.answer: The data aggregated by CISCAfrica will be accessible through our online platform. Details on access will be provided on our website.

faqs.question: What is the geographical scope of CISCAfrica?
faqs.answer: The CISCAfrica project covers citizen initiatives across the African continent, with a particular focus on countries in the West African sub-region.
